results.title: Temperate rain forest
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of a group of short films on various climatic, geographic and ecological zones in British Columbia, The Temperate Rain Forest examines the special characteristics, including the life cycle and food chain, of the northwest coastal rain forest. Its highly acidic soil results in a specialized plant community and an abundance of amphibians and reptiles. As the camera reveals, it is a place of exquisite beauty, and one that has an important place in the ecology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Ana: an interpreter
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Ana is a Spanish/English interpreter in a Sydney family centre. The film shows some of the problems with which she works - human rather than linguistic ones - and her relationships with English-speaking co-workers. The film is designed to raise questions about the need for communicators like Ana and about the isolation of non-English speaking people.

results.title: The Thompsons: migrating to the city
results.creator_credit: Meg Stewart, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of a family who have moved from a small country town to Sydney for the benefit of their children. Discusses some of the problems and differences they encounter. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Telling a story in pictures
results.brief_description: An amateur film designed to demonstrate basic camera technique. The first half of the film, Version 1, is shot entirely in one and the same longshot. A little girl takes a parcel up to the door of a house, leaves it on the porch, runs back to the gate, hides behind it, and watches the lady of the house open the door, pick up the parcel, shake her head and walk in again. The second half, Version 2, is precisely the same story told with the judicious use of medium shots and close-ups. Thus we see the message in the box - `April Fool’ - and the reactions of both the little girl and the lady.

results.title: Peer group
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This series of comic sketches and songs attempts to show the positive and negative outcomes of peer pressure on teenagers. While friends are valued, the message is clear; individuality should never be threatened by group pressure. Although the program offers few solutions to the problem of peer pressure, it does present the issue from a teenager’s perspective.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A series of comic skits and songs which give a teenager’s view of family life. Deals with parental discipline, or lack of it, sibling rivalry, freedom, broken homes and family disputes.

results.title: School
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This anarchic series of comic sketches and songs expresses teenage views on school and teachers. School is seen as a meaningless prison where the students are given no space or time to explore and create.

results.title: Love
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This episode focuses on teenage reactions to love and relationships. Through mini dramatisations, issues such as crushes on teachers, how to be attractive to the opposite sex, romantic fiction and sex-role stereotyping, are examined in a humorous manner. This program aims at validating the experiences of teenagers rather than offering any concrete solutions.

results.title: Food
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A light hearted look at food by a group of “hungry” teenagers. Diets, fads, junk food addiction are discussed in a series of comic sketches and original songs. Information about nutrition and healthy lifestyle eating in a palatable format for adolescents.

results.title: Future
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
Is there life after puberty? This program examines through a series of comic sketches and original songs, the fears and expectations of teenagers as they anticipate leaving school. The future is seen not only as a time of adventure, but uncertainty, where key decisions must be made. School, life at work and the responsibilities of being an adult are highlighted.
